abstract.p: Publicis Groupe in Paris is reorganizing its American operations under Robert H Bloom, chairman and chief executive of what is being called Publicis in the US, by forming three regional centers from eight separate offices; executive changes noted (S)

block.p: Publicis Groupe in Paris is reorganizing its American operations under Robert H. Bloom, chairman and chief executive of what is being called Publicis in the U.S., by forming three regional centers from eight separate offices.

Publicis in Mid America, based in Chicago, will be the regional center combining the Publicis Dallas and Indianapolis offices with the Chicago office of Publicis & Hal Riney. Barry Krause, 46, who had been president at Publicis & Hal Riney Chicago, becomes chairman and chief executive at Publicis in Mid America.

Publicis Groupe in Paris is reorganizing its American operations under Robert H. Bloom, chairman and chief executive of what is being called Publicis in the U.S., by forming three regional centers from eight separate offices.

Publicis in Mid America, based in Chicago, will be the regional center combining the Publicis Dallas and Indianapolis offices with the Chicago office of Publicis & Hal Riney. Barry Krause, 46, who had been president at Publicis & Hal Riney Chicago, becomes chairman and chief executive at Publicis in Mid America.

Steve Price, 48, and Seth Werner, 45, who had been co-chairmen and chief executives at the Publicis Dallas office, become co-presidents of Publicis in Mid America; Mr. Price will also be chief operating officer, and Mr. Werner will also be chief creative officer. The San Francisco office of Publicis & Hal Riney remains an autonomous unit, reporting to Paris.

The Publicis New York office is renamed Publicis in New York and continues as the agency's American headquarters. Tony DeGregorio, 52, remains president and chief creative officer; a chairman and chief executive are being sought.

Publicis in the West, composed of the Boise, Idaho, and Seattle offices, will be based in Seattle. Dennis Miller, 47, chairman and chief executive at Publicis Seattle, becomes chief executive at Publicis in the West, and Gail Anne Grosso, 44, president and executive creative director at Publicis Seattle, continues in those posts at Publicis in the West.
